sub_topic: Determining the surface area of a cone.
message_1: A cone has a radius of 8 cm and a slant height of 11 cm. Find the surface area of the cone rounded to the nearest tenth.
message_2:
To find the surface area of a cone, we use the formula:

Surface Area = πr(r + l)

where r is the radius and l is the slant height.

In this case, r = 8 cm and l = 11 cm.

Surface Area = π(8)(8 + 11)
Surface Area = π(8)(19)
Surface Area ≈ 3.14 × 8 × 19
Surface Area ≈ 3.14 × 152
Surface Area ≈ 477.44

Rounded to the nearest tenth, the surface area of the cone is approximately 477.4 square centimeters.
